subject.name: Nutrition
subject.comments: NOTE: The designation for NUTR 1322 has been changed to BIOL 1322. Course content remains the same.

subtopic.name: Microsoft Advanced Word 2007 - May be substituted for POFI 2331-Software Specialist Application Certificate.
Records and Information Management - May be substituted for POFI 1301-Office Assistant Certificate.
Business Math and Machine Applications - Required for Accounting Certificates
Cooperative Education - Required for AAS Degree
Business Communication / Correspondence - Required for AAS Degree

topic.name: Introduction to Computing Courses
topic.comments: NOTE: ITSC 1401 is a Technical/Occupational course required for certain Certificate and Associate Degree plans. It will not meet the Core Curriculum and/or Associate in Arts or Associate in Sciences requirement, and is not for transfer to a four-year school.

topic.name: Game, Mobile and Media Programming Courses
Microsoft Academy Courses
topic.comments: NOTE: Brookhaven College is a Microsoft IT Academy and offers courses and curricula preparing students to take and pass Microsoft certification exams and to fulfill the requirements for a Networking Administration and Support AAS as a Microsoft Certified IT Professional (MCITP) Server Administrator and a MCITP Enterprise Administrator.

subject.name: Computer Studies - Business Computer Information Systems
subject.comments: BCIS courses are for those students wishing to take transferable courses in CIS/CIT. BCIS courses may be substituted for comparable courses in CIT degree programs.

subject.name: Management Program
subject.comments: NOTE: Complete two courses one night per week. Be mentored by full-time business faculty. Class format includes small-group discussions and networking with other employed professionals. Students taking management program courses at Brookhaven College for the first time must be advised by their faculty member before they register. Call Mary Lou Avera at 972-860-4179, e-mail her at MaryLou@dcccd.edu or visit www.BrookhavenCollege.edu/management.

topic.name: Medical Front Office Assistant Marketable Skills Achievement Award - First Semester
topic.comments: Note: Before you enroll, you must attend one of the following information sessions: April 27, 5:30-6:30 p.m.; June 29, 5:30-6:30 p.m.; July 20, 9-10 a.m. or 5:30-6:30 p.m.; Aug. 17, 9-10 a.m. or 5:30-6:30 p.m. in Bldg. M, Room M122.

topic.name: Medical Front Office Assistant Certificate - Second Semester
topic.comments: Note: To enroll in the second semester, you must:1) have successfully completed the courses above with a minimum final grade of C in each course and 2) attend one of the following information sessions: April 27, 6:45-7:45 p.m.; June 29, 6:45-7:45 p.m.; July 20, 10:45-11:45 a.m. or 6:45-7:45 p.m.; Aug. 17, 10:45-11:45 a.m. or 6:45-7:45 p.m. in Bldg. M, Room M122.

subtopic.name: Medical Front Office Co-Op Work Experience
subtopic.comments: Students must be able to meet on four required meeting dates: Aug. 28, Sept. 25, Oct. 30 and Dec. 4.

subject.name: Journalism
subject.comments: NOTE: Journalism 1307 surveys the field of mass communications. Journalism 2311 is a reporting course. Students may enroll in Journalism 2311 without having taken Journalism 1307. Room B212 is the student newspaper office.

comments.p: NOTES: Clinical opportunities are not available for any student without a U.S. Social Security number, http://www.ssa.gov/ssnumber/. Potential applicants should obtain a Social Security number before applying to Brookhaven College's health programs in Emergency Medical Services, Nursing and Radiologic Sciences. International students are advised to contact the Brookhaven College Multicultural Center, Room S136, bhcMulticulturalCenter@dcccd.edu, 972-860-4192, concerning this requirement.
If financial aid or veterans benefits are paying for your courses, you must enroll for all courses at the beginning of the term.

All EMS courses require CPR certification for infant, child and adult. This is the Healthcare Provider level by the American Heart Association or Professional Rescuer by the American Red Cross. Students can register for the EMS course without having a current CPR card, but must be CPR certified by the mandatory orientation day.

subject.name: Nursing
subject.comments: Clinical opportunities are not available for any student without a U.S. Social Security number, http://www.ssa.gov/ssnumber/. Potential applicants should obtain a Social Security number before applying to Brookhaven College's health programs in Emergency Medical Services, Nursing and Radiologic Sciences. International students are advised to contact the Brookhaven College Multicultural Center Office, Room S136, bhcMulticulturalCenter@dcccd.edu, 972-860-4192, concerning this requirement.

topic.name: none
topic.comments: NOTE: The following courses are available to anyone interested in the Nursing program. Acceptance into the program is NOT REQUIRED. For more information call 972-860-4754.

topic.name: First Semester Program Students
topic.comments: NOTE: The following courses are for students in the first semester of the Nursing program. Acceptance into this program is MANDATORY.

subject.name: Radiologic Sciences
subject.comments: Clinical opportunities are not available for any student without a U.S. Social Security number, http://www.ssa.gov/ssnumber/. Potential applicants should obtain a Social Security number before applying to Brookhaven College's health programs in Emergency Medical Services, Nursing and Radiologic Sciences. International students are advised to contact the Brookhaven College Multicultural Center, Room S136, bhcMulticulturalCenter@dcccd.edu, 972-860-4192, concerning this requirement.

topic.name: Third Semester Program Students
topic.comments: NOTE: These courses are restricted to students who have been accepted into the Radiologic Sciences Program. For more information call Christi Carter at 972-860-4285.

topic.name: Sixth Semester Program Students
topic.comments: NOTE: These courses are restricted to students who have been accepted into the Radiologic Sciences Program. For more information call Christi Carter at 972-860-4285.

comments.p: NOTE: For more information regarding dance courses, please call the Dance Department at 972-860-4122. For courses above the beginning level, placement counseling with the Dance Department is required.

subtopic.name: Beginning
subtopic.comments: NOTE: These courses are private lesson courses, by audition only. Students are required to audition in advance to be placed at the correct level. An accompanist fee may be required. Enrollment in a music ensemble is required for all students who are accepted into private lesson courses. Please call the Music Office at 972-860-4563 for more information.

subtopic.name: Intermediate
subtopic.comments: NOTE: These courses are private lesson courses, by audition only. Students must audition in advance. An accompanist fee may be required. Enrollment in core music major courses, including Theory, Musicianship, Piano Class and Recital (MUSI 9176) is MANDATORY for all students who are accepted into private lessons at this level. Please call the Music Office at 972-860-4563 for more information.

subject.name: English for Speakers of Other Languages
